channel.title: How do i declare variables? somone help urgent!
channel.description: how do i declare i just dont get it... what do i search or do somone plz help :confused:[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 04, 2008, 10:56:54 am[/size][hr]somone at least view it plz...

item.title: How do i declare variables? somone help urgent!
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Normally you declare variables along with the other variables of the same type.

Example:

You put booleans with other booleans
You put ints with other ints
etc.

Or, at the top of the class file or the bottom. (Making sure it’s not inside of a method)

Now if the variable will just be locally called, then you can put it right near the code that will be using it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i declare variables? somone help urgent!

item.title: How do i declare variables? somone help urgent!
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Rog3r, post:3, topic:229680”]A variable is a number, lets say X

public int X = 30;

This int (they can only hold numbers) determines that X is equal to 30 when you first log in, or the first time its called.
In a method, lets say we wanted to increase it by a couple.

x += 2

This will increase the int X, by 2.

So if you wanted lets say X to represent a starter thing, you would do this:

public int X = 0;

And then in the command add this:

x = 1;

But, we have to make an IF statement…

if (command.equals(starter) { addItem(995, 10000); x = 1; if (x == 1) { sendMessage("You already got your starter!");
(Just an example - won’t work)

And you would just add it to your save methods.[/quote]Variables are not only numbers… They are other things such as booleans, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i declare variables? somone help urgent!

item.title: How do i declare variables? somone help urgent!
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

A variable is a represents of a value, lets say X

public int X = 30;

This int (they can only hold numbers) determines that X is equal to 30 when you first log in, or the first time its called.
In a method, lets say we wanted to increase it by a couple.

x += 2

This will increase the int X, by 2.

So if you wanted lets say X to represent a starter thing, you would do this:

public int X = 0;

And then in the command add this:

x = 1;

But, we have to make an IF statement…

if (command.equals(starter) { addItem(995, 10000); x = 1; if (x == 1) { sendMessage("You already got your starter!");
(Just an example - won’t work)

And you would just add it to your save methods.

Read full topic
